info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 6:53PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EASTERN STOKES...WESTERN ROCKINGHAM...SOUTHWESTERN HENRY AND SOUTHEASTERN PATRICK COUNTIES THROUGH 730 PM EDT... At 652 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Spencer to Walnut Cove. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Mayodan... Madison... Walnut Cove... Stoneville... Spencer... Sandy Ridge... and Pine Hall. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
